summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General voluntary interview waiver form (OIG Form III-226/2) used to document an employee's agreement to provide information voluntarily during an investigation. The form includes warnings, assurances, and signature sections for the employee and witnesses.

persons.name: Olga
persons.context: Appears as the employee's name signed on the voluntary interview waiver form, indicating she is providing information as part of an OIG investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a voluntary interview waiver form from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General.
The form is used to obtain voluntary information from an employee as part of an OIG investigation, with assurances that no disciplinary action will be taken if the employee chooses not to answer.
The employee named Olga signed the form, agreeing to provide information voluntarily without promises, threats, pressure, or coercion.
